The movie shows the struggles faced by rocky on his journey to become powerful. Being an amazing story and concept, the plot is filled by loopholes that misses its epic mark. The positives of movie are its raw action, gripping screenplay,dialogues, its story,amazing songs,bgm, Great performance by Yash.
Well,what does not go well with the movie is the approach of one man army, which is not wrong, but becomes over fantasized a little, and dialogues too seem over fantasized sometimes. Well, Editing could have been a lot better.
So, overall kgf provides you wholesome entertainment and Yash particularly shines with his acting skills and style but sometimes the style doesn't look well.
Well, Ravi barsur should be credited for his amazing work of bgm and songs especially 'kokh ke Rath mein' and 'saalam rocky bhai' .
Overall, kgf is a nice attempt by Kannada film industry that misses its epic mark by some flaws.

reviews.review_title: Average movie, certainly not great like what other reviews say.
reviews.content:
Before drawing any comparisons I want to say that KGF is not a bad movie, but certainly not in the league of greats. The cinematography and the soundtrack are amazing and so is Yash, but there isn't much in the storyline. This is again another typical Indian movie where one person is given too much power. There are loads of fighting scenes in the movie which really doesn't make sense. Rocky(Yash) beats up nearly 20 people, alone. The transitions in every scene was too fast. So, that's a huge letdown for the editing team. Nearly 50% of the movie is just illogical fighting. Watch it only if you are a die-hard fan of Yash, and okay with more fighting than story.
Before you complain about Marvel/DC doing the same thing and people accepting it, let me tell you that those movies are set in a different universe and these superheroes have proper backstories to how they got their powers. Whereas here we have a normal human-being equivalent to a Hulk.
This movie is nowhere close to Baahubali. Period.
PS: I really loved Rangitharanga and Ulidavaru Kandanthe and they still remain my favourites.

Interval scene : 5 out of 5
The climax : 5 out of 5

One of the best movies of 2018. Action scenes are to the best. Story scores 100/100 marks. This movie is above bahubali 2. Great concept! Great action scenes! Slow motion has been used to the limits which is excellent!

There are two perspectives to this film. The international view and the local, subcontinental view.While the film does fare extremely well when compared to the kind of material produced within the subcontinent, it is in no way a gem.If you look at it as an international audience then it will most definitely disappoint you. You will find yourself forcefully sitting through in the hopes of it getting better, but it never will.The storyline itself is fantastic but is ruined by the protagonist beating up crowds of trained gangsters, alone with his fists, repeatedly. Yep. It felt like half of the film was nothing more than poorly choreographed and unnecessary fight sequences. The only good thing in those were the entertaining taunts from the protagonist himself.Other elements such as our protagonist wooing over the heroine by repeatedly harassing her were not realistic either and clearly exhibit how such needless elements of the film industry contribute to the already poor state of women's right in the primary audience.The CGI was very convincing however, if there was any CGI at all. All the locations felt very real, as well the humungous crowds of people numbering in the thousands. A difficult feat to accomplish with such a limited budget.All in all, i would recommend that you do not waste your time watching this if you are not accustomed to the generic Bollywood or Tollywood flick. But if you are, then I'd say that perhaps it is worth a gander.

KGF total review :-This movie has set a touchstone in both kannada & Indian cinemas

The story line has a class of its own & the narration is subtle 👌
Throughout the movie Neel doesn't let the audience take their eyes off the screen
Yash's monstrous screen presence glorifies the movie's pace
Bhuvan Gowda is inerrable as cinematographer with his stunning natural & realistic tones
Ravi basrur's background score is a true boon to the movie...time & again proving why he's the best when it comes to background score is Ravi basrur 💯
The characterisations aren't insignificant & every character is justified
No audacious addition of commercial elements 👍🏻
Director Prashant Neel has effaced all the stereotypes & has come up with a masterpiece film 👌
Over all the rating would be a whopping
4.3/5Strongly recommending everyone to watch 👍🏻

reviews.review_title: Could not handle two much swagger.
reviews.content:
K.G.F Chapter 1, The film is exhausting. Director constantly wants to create adrenaline rush moments and edge of the seat experience with super fast pace and over the top background score. Due to lack of powerful screenplay that trick became cheap. Ya we know that one have to show the swagger of superstar Yash. But there are too many slow motions shots and swagger moments and cheesey moments. These moments leave a bad impact on the story.
Acting of Yash is more of Swagger and less of depth and emotions. On papers the story is good but according to me the execution is super bad. Technically speaking , the camera work is great. Overall K.G.F. is an exhausting experience. And I am not looking forward to next parts.

reviews.review_title: The greatest elevations of all time!! 8/10
reviews.content: KGF directed by Prashant Neel starring Rocking Star Yash.This movie starts of with narration of Anand Nag to the Indian Prime Minister who wants to know the story of the India's most wanted Criminal who is of course Yash. This definitely builds curiosityUntil the end of the 1st half the movie in the eyes of a critique is a disaster but will appeal to the audience watching this film. The story is basically how and why Yash goes to KGF with crazy elevations along the way. The screenplay is very nonlinear. The movie also focuses too much attention on Yash rather than story. There are too many villains and characters to keep track off which might lead to confusion. The thing that director Prashant Neel did amazing in the first half is the thrill. He will constantly move the story at 1000 kmph and there is always something happening giving you the full thrill!!!The second half of the film is a cinematic wonder for the mass appeal. It starts of with Yash in KGF (a crazy villanous place where people are enslaved and treated horribly) and he has absolutely no way to get out. It shows how evil the villian is. Yash then somehow does the impossible against all odds and beheads the villian. Although there is no thrill in the second half, in the climax when the villian's head gets cut off its absolutely crazy. You will want to hug the character and you will definitely become a crazy fan. At that moment you forget all the flaws of the movie and come out with blockbuster level of feeling.Although this is a nightmare movie for critiques due to the nonlinear screenplay and mind blowing elevations its appealing general audience.

reviews.review_title: Over hyped and Over rated movie
reviews.content:
First let me tell about the things which I liked in this film.
1. The background score in the film is awesome. The bgm suits exactly to the situations in the movie and elevates the scenes.
2. Next thing to talk about is the heroism of the protagonist. The character of the Hero feels so powerful and audience does feel that he is going to acheive something impossible for sure.
3.Hero Yash does great job not only by his looks but also with his acting. I don't think anybody else would suit to this role except but him.
Now comes the actual review of the movie why this movie is Over hyped and Over rated.
1.This film is awkwardly fast paced and it is so fast paced that we tend to miss the track of the movie. Feels confusing about too many characters at one time and has no idea what is happening in the movie. Within fraction of
seconds somethingg keeps changing in the movie.
2.The film has flashbacks within flashbacks and feels like dragging and disconnects you from the movie because of poor narration of the story.
3. The director is a failure here because he seems to be in a hurry because the film looks that way and what he made was not a movie but a very big trailer.
While watching the we feel like we are watching trailer but really a very big trailer or it feels like we are watching ad's non stop.
4.The main focus was on hero and building his image but there is no proper story and also there is not much of an emotional connect except it feels a bit better in second half.
So clearly the film is overhyped and over rated but nothing new.

If you understand the origin language - Kannada, you will enjoy the literary dialogue better, but subtitles are fair enough.I would also like to congratulate Prashant Neel and team for an outstanding effort. The first thing you notice about filmmaker Prashanth Neel's ambitious two-part period crime film is the scale. The project is massive, in a 'Mad Max' meets 'Gangs of Wasseypur' kind of a way, where the action is as much about style, as it is about weaving an intricate tale spanning more than five decades, from 1950 till 2018. While one can see that the massive budgets have been put to good use with elaborate sets and a top-notch production value, one wishes that there was enough thought invested in the story as well. The non-linear narrative gets confusing at times and you come out just thinking about three characters which are Rocky, Seema (Srinidhi Shetty) and Garuda (Ramachandra). The remaining cast, while interesting, remains a blur.
The film clearly belongs to our protagonist Rocky (Yash), a kid from the streets of Mumbai who grows up to become a one man army. While his greatness is established in the first half, there are way too many scenes that go on to show how kick-ass our leading man is, which gets tedious, especially in the second half. All pumped up and in a gangster mode, Yash does all the heavy lifting here and has more than a dozen fight scenes, most of which are choreographed quite well. To match his angst is Miss Supranational 2016, Srinidhi Shetty, who delivers a confident performance as a feisty young girl and matches Yash's badassery scene by scene as his love interest.
For fans of Yash, there are ample moments to cheer and hoot for, and 'KGF: Chapter 1' will make for an entertaining movie outing. For those who are not fans, this one may be a bit too heavy, given that it is a dubbed version and that there are multiple characters to be tracked to make sense of the story. That being said, filmmaker Prashanth Neel has laid out the set-pieces quite well for a cracking sequel, which we hope, will be far better than this film.

Prashanth Neel's KGF is the most awaited film in the south with the the visuals shown in its trailer capturing the imagination of the film lovers. But does the team deliver to ensure the film meets expectations? Well, it certainly has its moments. The film's first half, though fast-paced, does seem a little long. But the second half, especially the climax, sets up the right premise for the second part of the film.The most exciting part of the film is its screenplay, with the non-linear pattern keeping the viewers engrossed. The growth of Rocky is shown steadily and the makers kept a clever story telling pattern right through, that keeps pace with the narrative. The director also brings out crowd-pleasing dialogues that brings out hoots and cheers from the masses. The transition between 1951 to 2018 is clever and maintains the viewers' curiosity as each character in unveiled.The most-awaited aspect about KGF has been its visuals and come release day, they don't disappoint. The art direction, cinematography and stunning locales add an extra edge to the film. From the dark, dreary world in KGF to the glitzy nightlife in Bangalore, everything looks top notch.Yash as Rocky lives his character to the fullest and has the crowd rooting for him with his majestic screen presence. The ensemble cast revolve around building Rocky's character, which each of them playing their part efficiently.The first chapter shows Rocky as the maverick mastermind who will stop at nothing in order to achieve his mission. While the end of the first chapter does provide a sense of closure, it leaves the audience yearning for more. If the makers wanted to build some momentum for its second part, KGF has certainly delivered what is set out to achieve.

Rocky is an ambitious boy, who wants to die as the richest and most powerful man. From the streets of Bombay to the fields of KGF, he embarks on the mission. And his tale is being retold by a journalist who chronicled his life in the 1980s.
Prashanth Neel's KGF, which stars Yash in the lead, has become arguably the most spoken about Kannada film nationally. The expectations have been enormous. Does the team deliver? Yes, they do. The film has a fast-paced first half, which does seem a little long, but the second half and the climax sets up the right premise for the second part of the film.
The screenplay is the most interesting part of the film. The non-linear pattern keeps the viewers engaged, with the growth of Rocky being shown in a steady fashion. While there are a fair share of scenes and dialogues that bring out the hoots and cheers from the masses, the makers have still maintained a clever story telling pattern that assures one to also keep pace with the narrative. The film traverses from 1951 to 2018, while maintaining a sense of curiosity as each character is unveiled.
Adding the extra edge to the film are the cinematography, art direction and the locales. Everything looks top notch and one is often left spellbound at the scenes. Be it the dark dreary world in KGF to the more glitzy nightlife scenes in Bangalore, all of them are shown beautifully. Yash, as Rocky, lives his character to the fullest and his screen presence definitely has the viewers cheering alongside him. The ensemble cast play their respective parts, with each of them playing minor building blocks in setting up Rocky's character.
The narrative in the first part builds the character of Rocky as the maverick mastermind who will not stop for anything until he reaches his mission. While there is a sense of temporary closure in the first chapter of the film, one also leaves the hall yearning for more. KGF surely seems to have delivered what it set to achieve.

I am from Kerala, and have never seen a Kannada film before. When I saw the first trailer of kgf my mind started saying that this will be my first Kannada film I will be watching. Since I don't know anything about the Kannada film industry, I can't comment on kgf's influence in Sandalwood but one thing I can surely say is that this film has taken Kannada film industry to an international level. According to me this film was much more risky than baahubali because its director and producer decided to make this pan India film exclusively with a cast and crew from their own industry (relatively newcomers). All the actors and technicians in this film were new to the non Kannada audiences. And certainly the risk paid off. Hats off to Prasanth Neel and Vijay Kiradangur.
I got to watch this film only one week later due to limited screens. But due to positive response screens and shows increased.
First half of this film was like fireworks, my ears got bursted. It was mostly like the old Amitabh Bachchan films. Its the second half which makes it a pan India film. More than the hero elevation scenes it was the mother scenes in the second half which gave me goosebumps. Her dialogue in the climax is what makes this film epic. There are so many amazing dialogues in this film most of them we have heard in the trailer. Coming to its lead man Yash, he is absolutely badass in this film. Truly a rocking star. I became your fan. Fights and bgm were rocking.
If I talk about the drawbacks of the film, editing is terrible especially in first half and there is lot of violence which fails to make it a universal film. The film ends in a plain way unlike bahubali 1 and infinity war which ended with a cliffhanger making audience restless for the second part. That's not the way you end a film whose second part is in cans. The villain character Garuda is not properly developed, there is lot of buildup given to him but nothing is shown clearly. Also the storytelling given through narration gets into your nerves as if audience are spoonfeeding kids. And confusion is spread towards various characters we see in second half, who is who?, what are they? etc.
On the whole, since kgf 1 ended in a routine way that's why unlike others I am not waiting restlessly for part 2 like bahubali 2 or endgame

reviews.review_title: Was the editor having a stroke while cutting?
reviews.content: I really wanted to like this film and to an extend I do. I dont mind that I had to greatly suspend my disbelief with the storyline as I do want to watch these over the top 1 hero beating up 100s of heavies for nostalgia but my God the editor and director were probably both drunk when cutting. I dont mind mixing the time line where the story is not linear, but what in all thats holy is up with thousands of cuts! Its so annoying. They shot it nicely, they got everything right then why not show it so the viewer can actually absorb whats happening. There is a cut almost every 2 seconds if not less. At points you'd think you're having an elliptic fit. I really feel sorry for people who watched it in a cinema. The goldmine sequence in particular was really poor, unclear and muddled up. In comparison RRR that has similar over the top action is amazing simply because they dont start chopping it every single second. I think they should re release this film with much fewer cuts.

reviews.review_title: Lots of action and drama with special effects
reviews.content: I am not into into movies of this genre ( specially the dubbed ones) but I was curious to see this movie after the huge success of KGF 2 nowadays. The movie correctly represents what the Indian masses want and they are in multitudes. The premise of the movie is age old with a protagonist who is larger than life and who rises from the bottom to obliterate the bad guys and deliver justice which the system has not been able to. Reminded me of "Deewar" (you have the sick mother and the boy polishing shoes). When he grows up he is now a paid assassin and contract killer Rocky with almost half of his face covered all the time. The villains are extremely nasty, cruel and the hero is honest, determined, powerful while the oppressed are downtrodden, extremely weak, famished and poor. This makes the situation favourable for conflict and pitched violence. There is some high decibel screaming, wailing, killing, explosion and destruction all in your face. ( I have a feeling that part 2 will have some more of the same with more intensity). All this for achieving power and accumulating gold. After bashing up the villains our hero is also quite a romantic guy mouthing suggestive one liners and innuendos to the haughty heroine. The style and swagger of the hero Yash is probably majorly responsible for the success of this movie. The huge colliery which forms the backdrop is indeed awe inspiring. The cinematography is excellent. A number of crowd scenes with night effect have been done skillfully. The editing of majority of the the movie adopts a unique style using a huge number 2 to 3 second shots stitched together which is quite a strain. The movie therefore has a large number of shots. The sound and the visual effects are in plenty and they are mind numbing. The acting is of the hamming type. Probably no one can be blamed since the production is designed that way. In any case the masses have loved the movie and the producers have laughed all the way to the bank. That is all that matters.
Must Watch!!! Avoid Zero, Brilliant Cinematography , Story and BGM . Great Direction, Plot is set for part 2. I am Very excited for part 2 . Go and Watch.

reviews.review_title: A movie BIGGER than MAD MAX: FURY ROAD

What a story-line, direction, dialogues, screenplay. attitude of heroine. The most important of all to be talked about is the VILLAINISM. This villianism goes on getting bigger and bigger as the story proceeds. This movie is huge, than Bahubali. Really need to appreciate the real HARDWORK of the entire team, and directional skills of the captain of the ship. The way the story is narrated is impressive. This movie is bigger than the biggest Hollywood movies. The BACKGROUND MUSIC is the KILLER. Mother sentiment is heart-warming, and the BGM associated with this is at peaks. Each and every dialogue in this movie is a JEWEL. This movie has LIFE in it. There is something for all of us to learn from this movie. Finally, the name K.G.F - itself proves to the world that it is THE FINEST of all movies from INDIA, and I call it KARNATAKA'S GOLDEN FILM of the Century.

reviews.review_title: A Visual Treat led by an Immensely Dynamic Superstar
reviews.content: This Prasanth Neel Directorial is probably the most ambitious Kannada film of all time, and its brilliance captured the hearts of Indian Audience. A Powerful film centering around Gold Mafias & Criminal Empire, the Hero's Emotional Journey alongside his mother's story immediately makes this memorable. Yash's Supreme Presence & Fan Favourite dialogues make it a Commercial Darling. Backed by Delightful Cinematography, emotional score & highly stylized action, this film has become a hallmark in Indian Cinema & People are in Frenzy waiting for Chapter Two. For the negative, there are some editing issues & the romance angle isn't that engaging.

K. G. F Chapter 1 is a movie like no other. Watching Yash as Rocky plowing through hordes of enemies effortlessly is just amazing to behold.The movie has a story like no other, it seems to rely on the action to get by, but it really has a deep, driving and thoroughly enjoyable storyline. Though not everyone may understand it at first.Yash as Rocky is just in a whole other world. It's like seeing a force of nature in action, the fight scenes, the romance weird as it is with Reena. Everything is just absolutely amazing to witness. I have definitely become a Yash fan after seeing him in just this one film. Also he got the girl... I don't know how that approach worked, but somehow, by the end of the movie Reena is declaring her undying love for him.Love everything about this film, acting, effects, songs and music, wardrobe's and dance. It all comes together perfectly in K. G. F Chapter 1!

reviews.review_title: It feels good when the film lives upto its expectations.
reviews.content: Honestly I was addicted to this movie since its first trailer was released. Then its first song came Salaam Rocky Bhai and it increased my expectations and after the 2nd trailer my expectations were sky high.The good news is the movie lived upto my expectations. I am impressed by the direction of Prashanth Neel and I will watch his first film Ugraam now. Art pieces by Shivakumar, Cinematography by Bhuvan Gowda and Background Score by Ravi Basrur deserves a praise as they just helped the film to make audience stick to it.Let's talk about pros and cons:-Pros:-1. None other than rocking star Yash himself. Man what a actor!! Took the whole film on his shoulders. He carried that mass look and attitude which can make people scream or whistle for him. Half of my money spent was satisfied by him only.2. Action scenes were good they were looking much better than the ordinary south action.3. Mom-Son relationship is a great way to make an emotional connection to the audience.4. Set pieces and visuals (HATS OFF).5. Supporting cast was good in there roles.6. The technicians behind this movie and the director and lead actor all are fabulous in there respective jobs.7. Dialogues can make you believe that we are seeing an gangster movie.8. The plot of this movie is the important thing for the audience to watch this movie. The Gold Fields. It really adds a different taste in the movie.9. It has that heroism which we expect in a south movie.10. Songs are placed on perfect time and they are good.11. Climax will force you to get excited for 2nd chapter.12. The first half shows the gangster life and the 2nd half comes to the real subject and shows KGF. This becomes entertaining as we will get to see different scenes and scenarios in the whole movie.Cons :-1. The first half is dragged a little bit. The characters are so rapidly introduced that one will get disconnected from the movie for a little bit.2. Heroism attitude gets a little cringy and overly done in the whole movie.3. Even the second half looks like a dragged one. With the continuous display of same emotions again and again.4. Action sometimes looks over the top.So my rating is 8/10.

reviews.review_title: A movie that could've been an epic..could"ve..
reviews.content:
The 2.30 hr movie could've easily been a 1.30 hr one, neglecting the heavy..really heavy slow mo's and build-up for the characters, especially the lead.
When we actually witness the character unfold itself, there wasn't much on the screen..similar to having an onion pakkoda, only that the onion is missing!Nevertheless, the pakkoda was good enough to remember its taste. The gold field environment (similar to the post-apocalyptic world in the Fury Road) caught my attention throughout the second half. The dark tone, grippy background score, and some meaningful scenes, made this worth the watch. Few scenes was written extremely well, but the casting let it down. But, as I said, the pakkoda was good!The final 10-15 minutes was so crisp, like a superfast express trying to make up for its delay. Well, did it reach on time?
I guess I will wait until the next one unfolds. Hope KGF holds on-to its name.

It is touted as the highest-grossing Kannada film, the fourth highest-earning Hindi-dubbed film after the Bahuubali movies and 2.0, an international success and was feted at the National Film Awards. It was dubbed to Hindi, Telegu, Tamil and Malayalam almost immediately after its Kannada release with much success. And Chapter 2 is in the making. Am I missing something here that everyone else seems to enjoy? And, to say that this is one of the films that give people a reason to watch movies coming from the South, as quoted in a blog and recommended to me, is just too much.Just how many times have we seen a child wronged at childhood to grow up with vengeance against the rich and the powerful as mighty as Sri Rama himself to be a Robin Hood to the poor? How many times have we seen unknowns infiltrating into gangs just to disintegrate the whole setup from within? Think Nayagan, Thalapathi and the umpteen Bollywood and Kollywood productions. Even the hero's nickname in the film is not original. I remember Sanjay Dutt calling himself as 'Rocky', a scrambler wielding kid-wonder who was able to achieve the unimaginable in an 80's crowd-pleasing matinee.The film narrates how a cartel enslaved people in a gold mine to extract the precious metal in secrecy in cahoots with the politicians. Even though it is made to appear that gold is smuggled from overseas, it was mined locally in a clandestine manner. Everybody wants to have a stronghold in its control, even gangsters from abroad. To get this message across, viewers have to endure senseless violence, ruthless decapitation, gravity-defying stunts and larger-than-life pyrotechnic display. Again and again, there are repeated scenes of the macho hero walking away, leaving behind a trail of a destructive cloud of explosions and cadaver.What spurred my interest while watching the movie was the fascination of man to gold. History of gold is as old as the modern history of mankind. It had been a fascination with Man for ages. The destruction of Aztec, as well as many of the advanced civilisations in the Americas, were solely because of gold. Rappage of India by Muslim invaders and 'traders' from the West was also due to this precious metal.It is said the temples of India in ancient times were so rich with gold that they could finance many of its international naval expeditions as well as create a conducive environment for research on science, mathematics and Nature. Its wealth became its very downfall as it also drew many barbaric tribes. The gold stock had to be locked away in underground vaults only which were only to be lost in the annals of history.The Indian diaspora has always looked at gold as their fixed deposits. In times of needs, jewellery is still there for the rescue. No need laborious credit application and credit ratings. The friendly pawnshop owners are always willing to take your piece at low-interest rates. Gold will go a long way.In one of the numerous Youtube presentations that I received recently, an economist was suggesting that perhaps with the amount of gold lying around in India, it could be used as leverage to secure loans for small businesses. Now that there is talk some countries are trying to put gold back as the golden standard as the value of currency instead of the Greenback, this could be a good option. With the colossal amount of gold lying around in India, this could be an exciting thing for the even big players to look into. But then, nobody is going to be so open to display their hidden treasures in public. It may attract the attention of the wrong kind. of thieves and legal pilferers from the internal revenue service. These significant changes require political will but the powers that be are quite content with the status quo. Many third-world leaders have parked their assets in foreign lands. Do they really care what becomes of the country they lead?

KGF:Chapter 1, I heard a lot about this movie, but unfortunately I missed to see this one in ,2018. It has been said, this movie got similar kind of response like Bahubali, in terms of action, strong script writing, character's acting. There's no doubt about it, that the movie has amalgamation of emotions and actions which works simultaneously from scene to scene. This kind of mixture, you won't see in Bahubali. Director,writer #PrashanthNeel, did an exceptional job which reflects his creativity, understanding of cinema very clearly. This is the USP of this movie, background score was icing on cake. On acting side,I 'm a bit differ, I can't imagine Bahubali without Prabhas, I don't think so any actor can portray the role with so much intense and conviction. In KGF, I can say #Yash can be replaced, his acting was also good but in some scenes his acting is not justifying to the character. As a rebel, doing action he's good, but as a wannabe lover he's ok but not apar (eg. in traffic scene, car driver scene). #SrinidhiShetty, as a heroine of the movie, I didn't see her performance according to her character, her role should be done by Illena /Tammanah, /CatherineTresa. Even the song, "Gali Gali mei first hai"- #MouniRoy got more attention as compared to Srinidhi. In this movie there's no known face of antagonist, but in KGF:Chapter2, we will be seeing #SanjayDutt as Adheera. Watch this movie for screen play and script, with exceptionally strong storyline.
It is 8 on 10.

This movie has got everything you want from action, emotion, thriller and offers you a full package which you can't refuse. Just go and watch the movie then you'll know what i am really feeling.

Finally managed to watch this movie and i should say that it was worth it.The credit for it goes to Prashant Neel who manages to keep you hooked from the first scene and keeps you hooked till the end. The Action scenes are well choreographed and shot with panache with eye for detail.Yash as Rocky looks perfect for the role and does full justice to it.The scenes where he remembers his mom and her words of advice have been shot well and gels beautifully with the story.The item song by tamanah was totally unnecessary and could have been avoided.The cinematography and the background score is good.

reviews.review_title: Riveting Gangster Drama that leaves you Yearning for more
reviews.content:
Like is the case with many of action-thriller including the biggest blockbusters such as The War ,Tiger Zinda hai the story is not the strength of the movie but what works is electrifying Background music and Yash the angry young man aka gangster Rocky bhai charismatic presence.
The story has emotional touch to the life of this larger than life hero when his dying mother takes promise from her 10 yr old son to be one of the richest man in the World. Her upbringing,teaching through her struggles shines throughout the movie especially in the climax. Some dialogue might come across as cringy but many strike a chord with viewers heart one such as mother are the strongest warrior. The cinematography is top rate and action in the second half especially in the last 30-40 mins forces you to draw parallel with Baahubali.
And screenplay is written in such a way that keeps the viewers hooked with the growth of Rocky from streets of Bombay to the fields of KGF.The songs are alright. Rest of the Cast have done good job in the acting department. But the star of the show is Yash.KGF Chapter-1 unapologetically delivers what it set to achieve but it makes the viewers gasping for more of the drama.
Ultimate !! No word !!🤐🤐 Yash did a fantastic job!! His look, attitude, expressions, wow!! Hatts off to d entire team 🙏🙏🙏🙏🙏Uff !! What a movie ! Thrilled !! Waiting for part 2 👍👌🤘🙏

reviews.review_title: Annoying, comedic, pretentious and toxic at its highest peak.
reviews.content: K. G. F: Chapter 1 (2018) unironically and unsatirically overglorifies violence and peak capitalist mindsets, which explains a lot of why it became such a mega box office hit in India because these are the exact things you feed third world country audiences. The protagonist promotes the generic Indian OP main character grindset, which is "To survive and bring order to the society, I'll be part of the society itself. But I'm a good guy because I can 1v500 and no bullets can hit me. I kill a lot of people but who cares? Here, have a song where we shamelessly objectify women." I thought I would never get enough of Indian movies hilariously trying their very best to be badass but K. G. F: Chapter 1 (2018) really tested my limit, making me want to drop it from the first 15 minutes of the movie. Even when you view it without expecting much logic and storytelling still it's annoying, comedic, pretentious and toxic at its highest peak.

KGF seems to have good story-line and most actors have done good job. However, I can't help but draw parallels to Bahubali which had the same theme. Opressuve ruler in an inaccesible palace assailed by a lone warrior with story progression in flash backs.However, unlike Bahubali, KGF lacks the finesse, specially in the editing department. Very jumpy cuts between scenes. Too many characters in plat but literally zero cracter development. Story progression is not only nonlinear but chppy too. I do not want to put spoilers, hence cannot give examples.Leaves a lot to reserve.

reviews.review_title: An Important Mass film for Bollywood to Taste!
reviews.content: The Kannada film 'KGF: Chapter-1' starring the Kannada superstar Yash is a well-made blockbuster in every sense of word. It uses its cinematic tricks to make a clichéd film which is committed to its hero wholeheartedly, but it is an achievement, because it tells a strong underdog narrative with a dark, gorey, meaty undertone. The film has been scripted in an entertaining way, and nothing feels dragged. Its a strong film which uses its strength to make an ultimate crowd-pleaser with vintage vibes. It is also a visually stunning film which has a good pace. But above anything, it works as a massive improvement over any entertaining mass film- since it is a larger-than-life depiction of slavery in times when there are not many movies showing this in Bollywood.

reviews.review_title: A well crafted cinema but not cult.
reviews.content:
So I went to see this movie on the recommendation of one of my moviegoer colleague. I had earlier watched the trailer and it was indeed promising .
I have learnt something after watching this kannada movie .
I used to have this thinking that why in Oscar's among several others categories, there are these two categories , One is for "Best director" and another one is for " Best movie". Isn't it right to think that best director will obviously direct the best movie. So I used to think like when one category is enough why they are having two ?
Previously ,in Oscars ,Some times both the awards have been awarded to the same movie , sometimes not.
For example in 2017 Oscars , moonlight was the "Best movie " but for the best director award, it was given to Damien chazelle for la la land.
Obviously I was wrong to think like that.
I had this confusion but never tried to solve this problem but KGF did this for me.
In short KGF made me understand why we need two different category and not one, that KGF can be nominated in the category for the best direction and has the ability to win it too but the same can't be said if it is to be nominated in the category of" the best movie "
Question is why?
KGF is a very well crafted movie but it's not the Gangs of Vasseypur which is considered as a cult , Where director took completely different narrative line to tell a story which never has been adopted before. The characters we saw , were never seen before.The same goes with "Tumbaad" & "Andhadhun" . The directors of these movies , have no references to follow from where they can take inspiration. These movies are very much original while KGF took heavy inspirations from other movies, like it took from 300 in terms of color and texture.
KGF has a decent storyline which has been pictured very well that means editor has done his job superbly. Cinematography is outstanding. You will find great contrast, in fact in every scene. Black is like a new character in this movie. It will force your mind to concentrate on the characters . With a budget value of 80 crore, production value is top notch(Here it is appropriate to mention that gangs of vasseypur 's budget was 9 crore).It never feels for a bit that this is a regional cinema. Dialogues are well written. Infact some lines are very impressive. Background score is appropriate for a movie like this ,upto some degree feels like inspired from bahubali but not copied.
So where is this movie lagging? It will be harsh to judge this movie while comparing with world class cinema. We have to remember that this is a regional cinema. Where budget is generally tight. So you have to pour some commercial aspects too into the movie. Cause , at the end of the day money matters. Though, having so much good ingredients like story, camera work and production valve but it feels like we are watching a regular masala telugu cinema at some point where everybody's moto is to praise and worship the hero throughout the movie,where He can able to kill thousands of people with his bare hands only and not a single bullet will touch him. You will think when hero can be shot down with a gun from distance then why so many goons try to kill the hero with same old sword and knife. Again it should not be forgotten that these things have been done deliberately for mass purposes.
If you can put behind these things which I think you should, you will able to appreciate the movie which you must.
This is the 2nd picture of Prashanth Neel,(courtesy to IMDB) first one was Urgaam. When you will see urgaam you will start to feel the commonality between the lead characters of these movies. It seems what he had not able to achieve in urgaam , is trying to achieve here.
I will give 7.5 /10 solely for director's vision and execution of this project. A well crafted movie but not extraordinary or cult.

reviews.review_title: KGF IS NOT DONE YET....CHAPTER 2 ON IT'S WAY.......
reviews.content:
Still remember the date 21/12/2018 night show 9 to 12 when I first time entered the world of "KGF"....... After watching this movie I don't know why but.... I have started to feel something different.... This insufferable piece of trash is a part of the mainstream movie making culture in the South Indian state of Andhra Pradesh. Most films from that part of India are deafening loud with saturated colours and archaic plots. The ridiculous levels of hero worship indicates a repressed audience that lives it's wet dreams through screen heroes. I'm a fan of larger than life blockbusters but these Andhra films are unrefined, amateurish and wannabe. They thrive on cult following from fans who are not known to have a taste in cinema. KGF rocky is no exception to this tradition that has thin plots, fossilised storylines, on the nose dialogues and caricature action scenes. Though I mist admit that the cinematography amd editing is good and these films ride on these 2 aspects.
I can't believe this. Don't have any words left to explain how I feel after watching this movie. I watched in Hindi version but it would have been more ferocious if I knew kannada.

reviews.review_title: This was new for audience of our belt
reviews.content: Quite unexpected cinema experience for our Karnataka Belt1. I like the fact that this has believable storyline despite its intense action experience. The story has the character of Rocky well justified. This when viewed through the story aspect, the character justification and "uniqueness" moments makes it good. No parts make us feel that the character is doing what he was not supposed to do or like its not what his character does. The blend is good when it comes to be an epic of a villainy oriented film yet shining with well character moments of the goodness and natural hunger.2. I like the film because of the quite unique and unseen ( in our parts at least) color grading and cinematography presentation of the film. Bhuvan Gowda stands high in this field of expertise.3. I don't rate the BGM. It fits this genre and to this movie excellently. Songs have memorable rhythms and sounding. Good work.4. As an audience, Yes intense story telling, u need to keep your cerebrum working high. Promising. I hope KGF 2 too will have good story extension, experience and experience.5. Need to agree that this is truly a character based film or an epic based on him. And it mainly shows the unjust in the gold mine seen through his hunger eyes makes him more prominent. The confidence, hunger, qualities shown at some instances is what actually BUILDS EMOTION FOR HIM/for the epic. The action, style just adds to it, but it also serves as the main dish for those cinema people who have toned their tongue to extreme mass movies.What I did feel was useless - nothing prominent this time, fits good under its niche.

K.G.F: Chapter 1 is one awesome movie with all the ingredients for a good movie and it just delivered all the promises that the hype had created with trailer release.
Most of the time when a movie trailer is released and if becomes viral, the chances of the movie to be equally good and to keep up the same expectations is very difficult. In most of the movies, most of the best scenes are shown up in trailer to make it interesting and when movie is watched we see those are the only scenes that are good in the whole movie. KGF does not get into this category at all.
Throughout the movie something is constantly happening and viewer is constantly hooked up to screen in trying to find out whats happening next. Kudos goes to the director who has also written story and screenplay where the screenplay is so gripping and engaging and the direction is just awesome!!
Next key aspects for the movie are cinematography, background music and art direction. The visuals are just stunning throughout the movie especially the shots in dark light. Background score is just superb and engages the viewer very well the with story. And surely the mining set is just awesome.
Last but not the least is 'Rocky Bhai' Yash. He just looks awesome on the screen!!
The whole movie which is more than 2.5 hours seemed like it completed in no time at all and the climax was totally unexpected and the movie has stopped at a perfect stage setting for next chapter.
Eagerly waiting for Chapter 2!!

Absolute cracker of an experience that will overwhelm you with amazing casting, dialogue, cinematography, art & editing. And to top it all, you have an immensely visioned director who is at the helm that has got Yash at his disposal to deliver such a master piece. Can't wait for the sequel...

reviews.review_title: It is a Mass epic for you, if you know that what you're looking for..
reviews.content:
Some movie-goers found it as a Typical kannada Action film of Heroism, on other hand for a huge number of movie-goers It is a Mass epic. ( So, in that case audience should know about the genre cause their film experience depends on it otherwise they will get Dissapointment I.e. If you looking for a toy then go to a toystore, not a grossary store..)Story-
A Journalist and her team takes an Interview of a Retire Journalist about his book which Government has banned for some reason. As the story Continues it unfolds the mystery behind Narachi Limestone Co-op and Kolar Gold Fields.Review-
As personal experience this film comes out as a Mass Hit. There are some regular elements that we have seen in several film in kannada films. But what makes this one unque, is the direction, screenplay, story and how can we forget the Baground Music which takes it to another level. The first half seems as a long running introduction period and information comes like rain. But at the 2nd half it change the whole scenario. Certainly everything makes sense. The action taken by the characters, character dynamics, Atmosphere, themes everything. It starts to redefine the Mass-Class. At the end where it takes a major
Pick. Yes, it is damn risky but the makers takes it. Also it works. Apart from these, all actors gave their best. At last, It is a Mass epic- if you know that what you're looking for..*(Mistakes are forgivable, some words, sentence structure can be incorrect because my first language isn't English. This review Is just a opinion of my own; many reviewers can disagree. I wrote just for a entertainment purpose.)

reviews.review_title: Subtle propoganda of non-existent hindu oppressive majoritarianism
reviews.content: Rocky, born to a hindu mother, has no external signs of being a hindu, but as a boy wears a 'taweez', and is later addressed as 'sultan' and 'bhai', all of which are 'peaceful' style. The head of the hindu family running the hyper exploitative gold mine enslaving thousands of poor villagers, is hindu, but is bedridden and weak, and could not be glorified in any manner. The oppressed villagers enslaved in the gold mine, are all dhoti wearing people, never a skull-cap wearing 'peaceful', and never once has a 'peaceful' gold-digger shown in a vulnerable/weak position. Rocky never once shows his hindu identity. In the beginning of the film the never-ending done-to-death-cliche voice-over tutors us that as he needed a brand name, he changed his original hindu name to 'Rocky'. So convenient! One wonders why 'Rocky bhai', 'Salam Rocky bhai', both of which are 'peaceful' style lingo. The worst is when the festival of hindu kali godess, worshipped by the exploitative hindu gangster family, is shown to indulge in human sacrifice, and during the festival Rocky comes from under the water to slay the hindu son of the late Godfather.No one talks about Islamic jihad in India, and the slow never-ending genocide of hindus by the jihadis, and instead Bolly makes films showing hindus as oppressive and exploitative, obviously trying to counter the real-life filthiness of the jihadi religion atleast in films by showing hindus in bad light, and also to create a narrative that hindus are like their representation in the jihadi-funded films.KGF also does the same, as has been the lifelong project of Salim & Javed chichas, junky Nasirudeen, and the pigmy khans.KGF is a third-rate film, with zero artistic value, with a non-stop supply of done-to-death cliches, and its success signals the death of art in cinema, and the dead-and buried aesthetic sense of the audience,their hearts and minds destroyed by item numbers,innuendo and glorified violence and gory revenge-tales. The protagonist's interview revealed his sad lack of depth about art and politics. The films has made tons of money, but it is just sad, really heart-breakingly sad for cinema. One wonders how long we'll have to tolerate cheap copies of 500-year-old third-rate film-cliches, until real individuality breaks through, and minimalism and simplicity returns to empower us.

KGF has exceeded the enormous expectations it had built up following the trailer release. Fantastic job by the director Prashanth Neel, his crew of top-notch experts. Screen presence of Yash is delightful to watch.

Not to somebody who doesn't like blood, violence, action because they will not appreciate the cinematic brilliance of this movie.Now coming to the movie, find a theater having good speakers ensembled and has good picture quality.The first half build's up the story with some typical South Indian Masala Movie flavor but in good taste.
Viewer should really pay attention to the narration in the beginning when many characters are introduced in no time, I feel you'll miss the plot if don't.
As it happens with any larger than life character there is lot of build up to the main character (Rocky). I wouldn't mind it as the Director is not trying for an Oscar nomination here and its required for a great showdown.
But does it put the audience off may be may be a little bit. And as you think you are losing interest there comes a scene which will hold you back and believe me this will happen on more than one occasion.As you pass through the first half with some entertainment, some emotions and of course a little bit patience take a break and get ready to enter "Kolar Gold Fields" and the pure technical brilliance of the entire
team of "KGF".Start the second half the Director will take you on a Joy Ride have fun and you'll come out of the theater Satisfied.There are moments you feel perhaps you should spend some more quality time with your mother(The Ultimate Warrior).High octane background score, Very good cinematography and finally good editing, screenplay and Direction.
All the actors have done justice to the role given to them.The climax is something I could guess moments before as by now I was already in awe of the Director's caliber and moment has come for Prashant Neel to showcase his touch of brilliance.So Chapter 1 has been concluded at the right moment and the stage is set for a mega finale in Chapter 2 with all the threads open.I hope Prashant Neel will weave them efficiently and not disappoint because a lot of people by now are waiting for Chapter 2 including me.

reviews.review_title: Good cinematic experience but not worth 9+ rating.
reviews.content:
I saw the trailer and decided not not watch the movie. The trailer was looking good but at the same time too much slow motion. So I didn't visit the theatre for a week after release. But the reviews over the internet were positive, Every review on IMDB was like 10 ,10+.
My colleague watched the movie a day before and his response was "This movie is better then Bahubali". I regret not watching Bahubali at movie theatre in past, So I didn't want to repeat that mistake again. Also the word of mouth were very positive for the movie, So I decided to go there. I reached ten minutes late , Even after a week and constant availability of movie tickets the theatre was well Crowded. The movie was as expected . Typical south Indian movie in terms of physics. I always like the energy and storytelling of South Indian movies rather than actual physical action which audience cheers.
The story was well engaging , full of energy , some of the best cinematography I would say. But still I would say it was too much. For example the introductory scene where he fights everyone despite being chained or the scene where he pour over petrol in the bar and enjoy a cigarette, RIP Physics because in reality if someone even try to lit cigarette from a distance in that kind of condition he/she will get burn alive because petrol is volatile. I am not giving this a 9 but 7 for whatever I have experienced .

First of all, the cinematography is amazing to watch. Climax makes you excited to watch the sequel. It's treat to watch for the Mad Max fans. The movie plot is highly inspired by Mad Max 2 (1982). Just like Mel Gibson in Mad Max 2, Yash does not show more variations (intentionally as the story demands) in the expression meaning you can see hardly any change of expression through out the movie. Whether it's an extraction of gasoline or gold mining, you can relate this movie with Mad Max 2 (aka Road Warrior), be it in taking and long shots. Director has intelligently taken the KGF concept to make look authentic, viewers would not think of waste land, Lord Humungus and other similar character that you see in the Australian flick. Choosing of location, instead of VFX was a brilliant idea. Narration of gold value getting higher can reveal the plot being inspired by MM, if you have watched MM series. The story is more focused around hero which could have been trimmed to include more story building as you get bored of Yash. Overall, the movie keeps engaged with the introductions of more and more characters which keeps you bored through out first half. Second half goes steadily which gives you a breather to get involved in the story. Waiting for the sequel anyways for the rest of the predictable plot. Over hyped made this movie a huge Kannada hit else waste of time with head ache

He is the man of words.The DoP Bhuwan Gowda is just wow what a breath taking visuals (an idea just using match stick is brilliant) , BGM's from Ravi Basrur was increasing the pulse rates with the Mesmerising background songs from Ananya Bhat in BGMs synced the story lines perfectly, every actors in the movie had a story to tell about, surprisingly hero doesn't have many Dialogues in this movie, but for the rests the gripping Dialogues with indepth meanings touched everyone's heart. Don't know who decided to have Ananth Nag sir for Story Narration stunningly he is Irreplaceable and listening to his voice is awful. Take a bow editing team your hard work pays off. The Art work especially KGF shot location was complete plus to visuals, and last but not least the performance from #Yash is spell bound with his characterisation, Although there is extreme heroism in few cuts but story demands such elevation and required to hold the audience pulse for the screen play.Make up your mind few scenes shall never be missed while watching, when a mentally ill person narrates fiction story, when Ananth nag completes malavika's poetry, Mother Dialogues, Never ever miss voice overs.Finally the climax with nerve wrecking performances from every small character artists with brilliant taking was astonishing, the way scenes took the fast pace and the way it was portrayed with different narrations is amazing, If you blink you miss the link.As concluded in Chapter 1 the Story of the movie is just started, but where it leads to the end script we have to wait for Chapter 2. reviews.review_title: Overrated due to regional film audience
reviews.content:
Kannada audience hail this as the baahubali of kannada cinema. Sadly it is not. Kannada audience are only praising this filmand giving it high ratings out of loyalty while overlooking all the flaws. This is a decent attempt at a big scale kannada film but fails narratively almost consistently. Alot of scenes don't have proper logic and don't make sense. The herione subplot is so tasteless and inconsequential to the plot, as well as the hero characters behaviour around her, it is actually embarrassing and cringe worthy. There are some good scenes in the first half but only a few. Second half also has a few decent scenes. The whole movie has excessive scenes of characters hero worshiping. It almost seems as if the director or writer didn't have enough content to pad the film out. Probably about 30 minutes of the film is just some side characters talking about some myths of a hero on an epic scale and how he will come one day and save people. All of that crap becomes so repetitive and just seems like window dressing for an excessively long film.
About Yash: this is my first film seeing him in a movie. Seems like an okay actor but I don't think he can carry a film on this level. Most of the film is basically set up for hero worship and he just doesn't have a big enough of a screen presence to warrant all of that. A lot of the scenes with him just have him staring blankly mouthing some lines with raging background music without any real emotion coming out. It's actually quite unfortunate to watch the actor emote so little in this day and age considering the times and scale of the project.
There are also way too many characters coming in and out of scenes, too much to keep track of, especially if you're not familiar with the Kannada from industry. It becomes confusing and it doesn't help that in the second half all of the villains look the same. It's a problem to the point where it becomes annoying and confusing and it really becomes serious negative for the film in the second half in terms of engaging with the story on any level.
One real positive I can say is the cinematography. The production team really strived for a big scale but to compare this to baahubali is just a disservice to this film because anyone looking to this film to get their baahubali fix will be disappointed. I had to drive an hour from home and pay $20 for ticket so all I can say in the end as an outsider from the kannada film industry is that this was disappointing but has merits.

reviews.review_title: A Perfect Saga of Cinematic Universe
reviews.content: You can feel emotion,love,Barbarism, Cruelty, insatiable thirst for Power and at the end Bravery. That killing BGM Of Ravi Basrur, Cinematography of Bhuvangowda,Neel's Screenplay and direction, elevating scenes, those dialogues and ofcourse Yash's acting were just awesome. All cinema lovers should watch this movie.

Spectacular cinematography, good storyline, acting and dialogue delivery. Good stunts but not realistic although no CGI has been used.
However, the pace is too much to handle. The plots lack depth due to this but keeps you always on your toes. Very hard to rate the movie as it excels in many areas but also falls short in some. Thoroughly enjoyed the second part as the KGF set looks mindboggingly real. It's a visual treat without any graphics or CGI. This is what sets this movie apart from others. I would have given it a perfect score if the pace was a little lower. Hope they fix it in the sequel. Well done guys!!

reviews.review_title: Chapter 1 sets the stage for a Macro level showdown in Chapter 2!
reviews.content: What's Passion? To work or put efforts on something repeatedly until you get it absolutely right, which one loves and holds close to the heart without getting distracted even for a second. In one of the interviews Prashant Neel, the Director had said that he has watched KGF more than 150 times while editing. He wanted to make his KGF, a near perfect craft. While shooting, Bhuvan Gowda, the cinematographer used to carry around 40kgs of the camera and its accessories on top while canning the sequences in windy and dusty region. The gigantic sets used to come down crashing after heavy wind and rains yet the Art Director, Shivakumar used to go back in erecting the same sets as they stood earlier. Yash, used to give multiple retakes with no sign of fatigue or feeling bored in that dust bowl.KGF will be made in two chapters. The chapter 1 is out and at the outset, it traces with pre-historical chronology world of events letting the audience know the importance of owning Gold and the battles for it. The chapter 1 deals with micro level of unorganized crime, Mafia and underworld. The Chapter 1 depicts about the greed and the race for one-up man-ship within many characters in getting the control of Goldmine, KGF. To enter into the Macro level of an orbit of world crime syndicate, one has to clear his way at the micro level. The dirt has to be cleaned to make way to the top. The chapter 1 ends at the doorstep of Chapter 2, which is meant to open for the Triangular battle between International mafia (for Gold), The interruption of India's Govt and Rocky (who valorously emerges out of KGF slavery, as a Messiah)The film is narrated through the author's (Played by Anantnag) First hand experience to a News Editor (Played by Malvika Avinash) As his book gets banned by the Central Govt. He traces the journey of rocky from his birth to establishing himself as the feared crime lord from Mumbai docks to Bangalore to finally his destined place KGF. The mother sentiment is well crafted and placed appropriately throughout the film. Though the story line is predictable and replicates Ugramm template. In KGF also just like Ugramm, many characters get introduced and thus challenges one's memory to remember the count of characters. Yash's introduction in an elaborated action sequence keeps everyone engaged and makes glued to the screen. KGF falters at few places in the first half. Yash-Srinidhi scenes could have been better. The army of supporting characters may be revealed more in the Chapter 2. It's the second half, which meets the expectation and ends with retaliating climax, leaving multiple threads open only to be tied later in Chapter 2 on another day.KGF, from start to finish, is full of high octane action sequences, The dialogues are sharp and effective, Music is average, but gets compensated through an outrageous BGM (some influence from the soundtrack of Hams Zimmer's "The Oil"(Dunkirk).On Technical front: The captain of KGF mines, Prashant Neel, the Director should take a bow for bringing his vision on screen. Editing is very sharp, multiple scenes are played parallel and also intellectually blurred at few places to showcase that the character had no idea about the things to come. Ravi Basrur's music is a downer, but his BGM raises the milieu in all the sequences. The cinematography by Bhuvan Gowda is top-notch and world class (he will get all the awards if nominated functions PAN India level in 2019). The never say die attitude of Art Director Shivakumar should get all the accolades for erecting such massive sets of mines, in the midst of the dust bowls. KGF has used 90% of sets and just 10% of VFX for filming. KGF- Chapter 1 sets the stage for a macro-level showdown in chapter 2.

The major part of the movie was shot on the cyanide hills. The gold mining process at the KGF mines has generated about 32 million tons of tailings called Cyanide Dumps. These dumps are the accumulation of the slurry waste and residue that was piped out of the mills, after the gold was extracted from the ore. The residue slowly hardened over time and formed huge hills around all the mines in KGF of soft fine dust. They were known as the Cyanide Dumps because of the cyanide content that was used in the process of gold extraction.

A decade ago, the Kannada film industry was striving hard to make quality films to join the race with other South Indian films for a Pan India recognition. People who follow KGF from Part 1 have a huge expectation for this sequel and Director didn't disappoint the fans in Chapter 2. Quite a lot of detailing went into the script to bring out the true essence of KGF from Chapter one.Prashanth Neel will surely join the list of top directors in India. He deserves all praise and applause for his great work in the film. The storyline is quite simple but the way it was written and narrated makes the film stand out from other commercial films. The inclusion of Adheera and Ramika Sen adds value to the script.In my opinion, KGF Chapter 2 is one of the best commercial films made in Non-Linear format. The film travels back and forth with some interesting twists and turns to unfold the remaining story. Prasanth Neel outlined and sketched all the vital characters with a purpose. The theme of KGF is to glorify the heroic acts of Rocky Bhai but at the same time, each build-up sequence is carefully coined with emotional value. The audience erupts in theatres for all game-changing moments.Yash again proves that he is the best in business to perform a powerful role like Rocky. His screen presence with a rugged beard look and fearless attitude is precise for the build-up scenes. The introduction scene of Rocky in Chapter 2 is a treat to watch. The climax encounter with Adheera gives an adrenaline rush to the audience. There are quite a lot of goosebumps moments in the film and the best among all is the Police Station gunshot scene.Srinidhi Shetty plays a less impactful female lead but towards the end, she performed well to an extent. Sanjay Dutta as Adheera gets a stunning introduction but his role was sidelined in the middle portion of the film as Raveena share the screen as Ramika Sen. All the supporting characters are connected well in the plot. Prakash Raj takes the role of Anant Nag as narrator but it was not engaging as it was in Chapter one.

It is a decent movie, but it is definitely overrated. One of few reasons this movie did so good was because of the plot. It has everything Indian audience demands, be it the Mafia, the excellent dialogues or intense action. The action scenes, no doubt, are great. If we ignore some of the exaggerated action scenes which are usually there in South Indian movies, it is perfect. Yash has definitely done a remarkable role as Rocky.
The downsides, however are that there are a lot of unnecessary scenes, which causes the viewer to disconnect from the movie. Now, it wouldn't have been much of a problem, but the fact that the main story itself is so extremely long, the movie could have been explained much better if some of those non essential scenes didn't make it to the final cut.
This, along with some more smaller issues, makes the story haphazard sometimes, and leads to getting the viewer confused as to what is actually going on.

reviews.review_title: Not your typical commercial mass movie
reviews.content:
On the face of it, it appears to be a commercial mass movie..but watch it & you will be surprised. While the first half does have the usual mass movements, the second half is where it truly stands out.
Whats really good : story, editing, acting, background music.
Whats not : item number song.
With a story having a lot of named characters, you get glued to it. Add great editing to it, & you don't have a single boring moment in the movie. Things just keep happening one after the other.
The movie has moments where you are reminded of movies from the past - Konan the Barbarian, Inception(music build up at the end), Baahubali, Deewar. But they add to the story telling.
Yash has done really well in this. Needed an intense actor for the main role...& he delivers.
Waiting eagerly for Chapter 2.

reviews.review_title: Cinematography and background score steals the show
reviews.content: I saw this movie in a small movie hall in Stuttgart. I was really impressed to see how far Indian cinema has come in terms of visuals. Cinematography was top notch, and throughput the movie it felt like I was watching a graphic novel. Some scenes in the mines reminded of Zach Snyder's watchmen with slow motion and detailed close up shots. Yash has a strong screen presence with his zero ducks given attitude. Although, some scenes made me really uncomfortable as they are gruesome and the background music makes it more intense. Definitely not to be watched with minors. But they can be forgiven as the story is gripping and you'll be completely immersed in massive sets, mesmerizing cinematography and breathtaking action sequences.On the side note, protagonists love interest has very little role to play, but the woman who has played mothers character makes you thank your mom once you reach back home after the movie. Overall this movie is better enjoyed in the theatres as the background music and spellbinding cinematography leaves you in awe.

reviews.review_title: *SOUTH never Fails Just Got True. KGF is a next level cinema.*🔥😍🙌🏻
reviews.content:
*Here's My Review for KGF (Kolar Gold Fields) - Chapter 1**Starcast* - Yash, Srinidhi Shetty, Achyuth Kumar, Malavika Avinash, B Suresh, Nassar, Annat Nag*Directed By* - Prashanth Neel*Runtime* - 2 Hours 30 MinutesSince I'm not familiar with the names of actors and other technicians from the (Kannada) Sandlewood Industry I won't be mentioning any names, I've only Focused on the Storyline and Performance by lead actor Yash.*SOUTH never Fails Just Got True. KGF is a next level cinema.*🔥😍🙌🏻It's a Grand Mass movie & I Thoroughly loved every bit of it. Powerful dialogues with impressive Cinematography & Background music keep you hooked to your seats as 3-4 narrations run parallelly & executed Very Well.1st half is a bit stretched but can be Bareable as it builds up a storyline to the main plot.2nd half is SAVAGE🔥, Everything that you expect (Mind-Bending Action Sequences, background music, The Climax twist (which is gripping), Top-Notch Cinematography and overall Keeping the Audiences Engaged.😍*Yash* gives a fabulous performance and takes the film to great heights. He looks totally convincing for the part. He surely has the potential to become big in the whole of India!*To Conclude,* KGF: Chapter 1 is an entertaining and a cinematic tale, Almost Equivalent to Baahubali, just19-20 difference.
It's surely a one-time watch for its grandeur, direction, mass appeal, and Yash. Go for it as #Zero is nothing in front of this Masterpiece.Can't Wait for Chapter - 2.*My Rating: 4/ 5 (🌟🌟🌟🌟)*

reviews.review_title: Let's welcome the pride of Kannada Film Industry : KGF CHAPTER 1
reviews.content:
KGF Chapter 1 ( Kannada) Review :
Arguably one of the best in class Kannada movies released in recent times . This movie is no less than epic . It is high octane action saga movie . The genre of the movie is low level fantasy .
Positives :
1. Yash's brilliant acting and screen presence . He holds the aperture of the entire film with his massy and classy acting as Rocky Bhai . The film has many heroes . Each one of them adds their own dimension to the movie. Anant Nag's powerful narrative was integral in taking the story forward and setting the stage for KGF Chapter 2.
2. Every Antagonist in the film has created their own powerful aura of fear in the hearts of the audience and the Hero.
3. Prashant Neel has worked a lot on the script of the movie . The screenplay is so good that you can't take your attention away from the screen. I really like the the motherly emotions in the movie. The dialogues in the movie resonate in your mind even after you leave the theater.
4. Ravi Basrur's music and background score takes the movie whole new level . The film has only two songs . It's very much beneficial in the case of the movie like KGF . The french orchestra in the song " Garbadhi " is a magical wonder .
5. Bhuvan Gowda's cinematography has literally made every frame of the movie look like a Hollywood movie . He is no less than a magical behind the lens .
6 . Art Director Shivakumar left no stone unturned in the detailing of the movie . The movie takes us back in time to late 70s . The set work especially in the mines is of a whole new level . I really like the Kaali Jaatre Set .
7. The Editor's crisp edits and the fast moving transition always managed to keep my attention on screen.
8. The top notch production value of the movie .
Negatives:
1. The lag in the first half.
2. Very less screen presence for the heroine Srinidhi Shetty.
3. This film was more suited for the youth , action film lovers and not for the family audience.
4. I personally feel that the item song could have been avoided .
Final verdict :
This film is the pride of KFI. KGF has set the benchmark for the the Kannada film industry .My rating for the movie : 4/5.

Right off the hook, I can see the appeal of this film - it has incredible cinematography, a stellar cast and a killer soundtrack. Shots were crisp and tasteful, Yash's performance was wonderful and the soundtrack just elevated the film to a whole new level.
However, all this hardwork was almost undercut/undone by the use of the "classic" South Indian film tropes, like random romance and overglorification of a male lead. The romance felt completely unnecessary and made zero impact to the plot (the plot would be same w/o it); it was a lazy portrayal of the romanticised stalking people call love on the silver screen but elevated to another level. The glorification of Yash's character was over the top as well and in my opinion kinda ruined the movie as a whole considering the movie is clearly targeted at a more mature audience and not 5-year olds. This also impacted editing of the film, which was generally a little frantic but was even more so during those 'glorification' moments. Some really beautiful shots were present but as they say 'too many cooks spoil the broth'.
The film industry is clearly evolving as the quality and style of direction is beginning to change but KGF gets held back by those cliche tropes in this case. I'm personally willing to forgive that as change doesnt happen overnight (these tropes have been present in South Indian cinema for decades) and KGF makes for a wonderful watch regardless. Look forward for chapter 2 :D

It is the story of ambitious Rocky's partial journey towards power and riches. The story is told in a non linear format which travels to and fro between 1951 to 2018. The film wastes no time and picks up steam from the word go. The first half episodes build the character of Rocky and establishes him has a powerful maverick don. It breezes to the interval with its share of cliche punchlines, multiple hero elevations, goose bumps and item song i.e. Typical commercial format story telling but with lots of style and swag.It is in the second half when Rocky enters the Dark Dangerous world of KGF the film further elevates and transforms into cinematic glory of epic proportions. Director Prashant transports us into a total different world of slaves, atrocities and marauding army of warlords. The visuals are of world standards and some scenes leave you spell bound. The film ends with a twist and leaves you yearning for the part 2.The movie is Karnataka's contribution to the pan India audience and director Prashanth leaves no stone unturned in making it a master piece. His vision has been told with utmost conviction and clarity. This movie sets a precedent for the upcoming Kannada movies and new local talents to dream big. Prashant's screenplay and multi layered story telling keeps you engaged without a moment of dullness in the movie. I liked the way he has inserted Rocky's mother episodes throughout the movie. You can easily call him Kannada's Rajamouli.Yash as Rocky gets into the skin of the role with ease. He is the principal character and is present in 80% of the movie. He sets the screen on fire with his blazing screen presence, dialogues, fights and style. I would say this is his career best performance til date. Shreenidhi looks fresh but very little role to offer. The kid who acted as junior rocky and the mother role are fantastic. There is a long list of new villains who all perform well and are presented effectively, special mention to guy who played Garuda character. Anant nag as a narrator is adept. Should say the entire casting is perfect.All technical departments have done their part with finesse to enhance the movie to another level. Cinematography by Bhuvan, artwork by Shivu, BGM by Ravi Basrur and costume designing are exceptional. The sets are huge and CG extensions look very realistic and of great quality. Brilliant colour grading gives that extra feel to connect to that period and geography. Editing in certain fight scenes were a little cluttered but overall good.Hats off to the producer for his guts.Though the movie has its minor flaws in some places it is nullified by the fast pace and engaging story telling.Overall a fabulous movie to be watched only in theatres. If you watch it online or on television the essence and feel will be lost. A film not to be missed at all. I watched it in Kannada. Options available in Hindi, Telugu, Tamil and Malayalam.# Supreetth.
