It is the best movie in South India KGF Chapter 1 might be an astonishing wonder for one section of film-goers who haven't yet been exposed to world cinema. But, honestly, it is little beyond an overstretched exercise in hailing the protagonist as invincible. The problem with films that have invincible heroes is that none of the challenges that the screenplay poses turns out to be engaging enough. This, in turn, makes K. G. F Chapter 1 a less than exciting experience.Prashant Neel has packaged the film with all necessary massy ingredients: there are slow-motion intro sequences, exquisitely staged yet pointless fights, and excessive hype created around the protagonist's indomitable aura. There are a bunch of scenes that try to reinstate the fact that Rocky (Yash) is unbeatable. It's clear from the very first scene that he's in. Yet, the director chooses to drive the point home over and over again. The dialogues too are some of the campiest I've heard in recent times. It's like no one in the film speaks normally. Everyone speaks as if they've been preparing their cheese-filled quotes/monologues for years, just waiting to spit them out at first given instance.Character-building is one area that the film lacks terribly in. We have more than a dozen (main) characters being introduced but none of them (and I repeat, none of them) are well-fleshed out. Even Rocky's childhood is just a collection of massy moments: he is pushed to the limit; his mom utters philosophical nonsense, and the next thing you see, he's beating people up in a jiffy. When Rocky grows older, he beats even more people up. Basically, the film uses the tired formula of one-man-against-many to build hype around the character of Rocky. This is something good old Shankar tried more than a decade ago and emerged a winner at. Prashant Neel attempts the same; he's supported greatly by his cinematographer Bhuvan Gowda (who assigns splendid colours to frames, often giving it a neo-noir touch), composer Ravi Basrur (the songs are bathroom-breaks but the background score was pretty epic), and the fine-looking production values (the set designs are elaborate).Where Neel lacks in the screenplay, he tries to compensate with cinematic gimmicks. The heroine, unfortunately, is a mere prop. She shows up in a couple of scenes (and a song) that do nothing but stretch the film's first half. In a film such as this, it would be criminal to even consider a well-written role for the heroine. In fact, the protagonist's mom (who appears in flashbacks) and a struggling pregnant mother at the gold mine receive better treatment than the heroine. Well, here's hoping she has something more to do in the sequel.The villains? I like how Prashant Neel tried to bring to the forefront not one, but a whole array of them. However, none of them manages to leave an impression. At the end of the day, they're just brawny halfwits who are not worthy of even tying the hero's shoelaces. K. G. F Chapter 1 certainly has a better second half (once the film shifts to the gold mine), though that it isn't saying much. I wish the director spent less time trying to write scenes glorifying Rocky and instead, focused on telling a more compelling story with well-rounded characters.I agree that a gangster movie needs its share of crowd-pleasing moments and even then, K. G. F Chapter 1 isn't a lot beyond an overly indulgent star vehicle. I'm not exactly sure if it's the packaging that impressed audiences or the frequent massy reminders; it definitely isn't the screenplay. Yash sleepwalks through the role of Rocky - one which thankfully doesn't require the greatest acting capabilities. This may be a benchmark for the Kannada film industry, but it's high time they realize they're still way behind when it comes to quality content and story-telling, because well, a brilliant technical crew can only do so much to elevate a mediocre screenplay. I hope to.

Late but definitely want to share this, here's my review of KGF(Kannada's GOLDEN Film):
I am a fan of good movies. A great script and the direction,drives me to watch and appreciate a movie. I am movie buff someone who goes deepinto storytelling. I don't watch because of a hero or particular any person in the movie.At first, I was excited about #KGF,by seeing the trailer thinking it's worth a watch. Since the time the movie got released, I wanted to go watch it asap before the reviews are out but due to other commitments and high demand (houseful shows) couldn't get to see before the word was out. Looking at craze of word of mouth, my curiosity and desire to watch the movie tripled. By now, I knew the names of the characters and slight guess on plot (thanks to instagram memes)
I went in with high expectations thinking what could b in here that's pulling all this crowd? 🤔
First half of the movie was the glorification of Rocky bhai. Fights and fights ...too massy meaty.. Felt like walked into another typical Kannada movie it's all about punch dialogues and exaggeration of the hero and his heroism. But still dint wanted to be disappointed. I had taken my kid along who was getting scared for the heavy backscore on every punch and fall. Holding her all through first half, I was waiting to hit the interval and kinda of given up on the movie😬... Thinking what did people like in this😐After watching first half,Since I knew the names of characters I guessed my own plot. My early high expectations and eventually being slightly disappointed and with managing scared kid all through... started to feel the pain (body ache) of holding my kid...Post Interval- EL DORADO 😱😱😱😱😱
Actual movie had arrived!! Got hooked to my seat.Blown away by the cinematic experience. Narration, cinematography, backscore, heroism etc etc... I was so much into the plot that I felt like one of them who is seeking help from Rocky bhai...The body ache due to holding my scared kid had vanished....I din't wanted to leave the hall🙏🏻🙏🏻🙏🏻🙏🏻... had to pinch myself to see if it was real, it's a kannada movie that I watched. First half made sense on seeing the second half of interval. Why the glorification🙏🏻🙏🏻😇
Rightly said it's no less than hollywood movie... hardwork of 3yrs is evident..A Avatar of Kannada industry!! Proud to say Kannada movie making has arrived beyond glorification of heroes 👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻 waiting to experience #KGF2 Great work team #KGF ... Until now was not a fan of Yash but now you have earned it! Nobody could that job better!!👏🏻👏🏻

reviews.review_title: Will be remembered for years to come..
reviews.content: The scale of this movie is so unabashedly ambitious that one might wonder if it's a Hollywood project. You simply can't ignore the terrific hard work that must've gone into bringing out the bold vision of its creator into reality. The movie is not without flaws, but if flaws can make humans interesting, then same holds true for a movie too. It feels like a glorious mix of amateurish brazenness and insanely professional level craftsmanship. The passion of its creator is palpable in every scene and every frame. It is bold, boisterous, audacious, thunderstorm of a movie.If you can ignore some minor issues and immerse yourself into the story, you'll find yourself thoroughly surprised and totally drenched in its magnificence. The music, the BGS, the cinematography, the script, the editing, the pace... oh my god the pace... you better bring all your neurons here as the film will overwhelm you soon if you ain't paying attention. I can write heaps of praise just for the audacity to dream something so epic, but I need to save some praise for its leading, ROCKING STAR, YASH!! The man is the most manly man I have seen on screen in a long, long time. I think what he has achieved here can only be compared to the magic of the other ROCKY (Balboa) that we all know. He has lived the character like his life depended on it. Why the hell is he still not the shining icon all over India yet? He himself is the gold we all discovered in KGF, ffs. He deserves every ounce of hype he's getting. He is handsome, sexy af, has eyes that can pierce your soul, expressions that arouse all sorts of emotions, has a face fur that can even melt straight men. He is powerful, complex, a reluctant messiah, the dark knight. He carries this movie with such power I haven't seen anyone do before. The man was born to play Rocky.If you still haven't watched this movie, I envy you because you are in for a heck of a ride. Brace yourself for awesomeness!

reviews.review_title: Visually impressive but a narrative mess
reviews.content: Super high effort cinematography. Impressive visuals with an insane number of shots. When a character describes something that happened in the past there is a separate shot which visualizes each spoken sentence. The amount of work that must have gone into this is staggering.While the production is high effort, the English translation is anything but. The first half of the movie is a narrative mess, and this is greatly exacerbated by a weak translation. The result is that it's often unclear who the villain is or why we should care. The translation is also marred by typos and awkward phrases. This movie could have been a 7 or maybe even an 8 with an excellent translation.

reviews.review_title: How evil man can become when he denies the accountability in Hereafter
reviews.content: Quran: chapter Adiyaat makes the people realise how evil man becomes when he denies the Hereafter, or becomes heedless of it, and also to warn them that in the Hereafter not only their visible and apparent deeds but even the secrets hidden in their hearts too will be subjected to scrutiny. For this purpose the general chaos and confusion prevailing in Arabia, with which the whole country was in turmoil, has been presented as an argument. Bloodshed, loot and plunder raged on every side. Tribes were subjecting tribes to raids, and no one could have peaceful sleep at night from fear that some enemy tribe might raid his settlement early in the morning. Every Arab was fully conscious of this state of affairs and realised that it was wrong. Although the plundered bemoaned his miserable, helpless state and the plunderer rejoiced, yet when the plunderer himself was plundered, he too realised how wretched was the condition in which the whole nation was involved.Referring to this very state of affairs, it has been said: Unaware of the second life after death and his accountability before God in it, man has become ungrateful to his Lord and Sustainer. He is using the powers and abilities given by God for perpetrating tyranny and pillage; blinded by the love of worldly wealth he tries to obtain it by every means, however impure and filthy, and his own state itself testifies that by abusing the powers bestowed by his Lord, he is being ungrateful to Him. He would never have behaved so, had he known the time when the dead will be raised from the graves, and when the intentions and motives with which he had done all sorts of deeds in the world, will be exposed and brought out before everyone to see. At that time the Lord and Sustainer of men shall be well informed of what one had done and what punishment or reward one deserved.

reviews.review_title: Movie didn't meet the expected hype
reviews.content:
As a Kannadiga, we have always Produced a perfect complete movies in 70s, 80s & 90s in those days any expert would hardly find any defects in the Movies... I also wanted this KGF movie to be really good and come out of illogical Pattern movies that currently going on, but they followed typical Southern Indian Pattern no difference in this movie.My Review:Pros:
1. Yash appearance, Style, & Costumes
2. Dialogues
3. 2Nd galf was way much better
4. Good Cinematography
5. Good Story
6. Anant Nag Narration
7. Location was outstanding
8. Production cost could see throughout the Movie
9. Villans & side role acting was good
10. GOOD Music and BGSWhat I didn't like about the Movie: cons1. Over build up of Yash, I felt every seen of Yash is a Introduction throughout the movie.
2. 1St half was really Bad, looks fast forwarded
Very Bad Screenplay, we can see inexperience by director very clearly.
3. Fight scenes are same as usual pattern that there are carrying from last 15yrs are so. This is not a fantasy Movie so should have kept little realistic.
4. Some camera work in fights & dialogues are too clumsy.
5. Such a good story didn't build the Strong characters of Yash & Villans at the beginning. Felt some Fantasy commercial display and many things was left under audience assumptions. They could have taken inputs from Movies like "OM", "Antha" many old Kannada movies where they are very good in building a Hero or Villan character slowly.
6. If you show Yash can kill 30 or 40 people holding guns while hanging in 1st half then you must carry the same plot in full movie, but in 2nd Half you show him as normal person who needs to plan and kill everyone doesn't add up... Either make it Fantasy or Action, this is a biggest issue in Indian Movies to mix up thing and we end up seeing Fantasy even in Drama Movies....If you see Movies like Company, sholay you can witness each roles character and connect with it... Why do people still remember Gabbar Singh even today, and post watching KGF except Garuda I don't remember anybody else due to its pace.7. Over do of Music, this is another issue in recent Kannada Industry, unnecessary usage of Background music on every occassion which losses it's weightage.
The best they could have done was carrying Yash upbringing and how he adoptes to the Underworld role and making contacts could have been as 1st Part and closing scene should have been that he making Entry to KGF and entire concept of KGF should have been a secret to audience as 2nd Part, there they could have had enough time to screenplay each characters and building them....This way we cannot make Kannada industry famous, we require lot to of Improvements. If we just follow Kannada movies of 60s to 90s, they always had a complete movie. Under direction of Puttanna Kanagal etc, they would not compromise on any single point whether it's Music, Direction, Screenplay, Dialogues, Character selection etc...The reason I'm giving 4 Out of 10 only to compensate emotional over rating by others, else this Movie deserves 6.5 Out of 10

The cinematography and colour grading are truly fabulous.
The way they have used the grain and muted colours in every scene is terrific. The director of photography did a fantastic job. The framing, lighting and muted colours in the edit are like mesmerizing.
The jump cuts in this movie are extensively used which feels like a 3-hour trailer. It feels like a Guy Ritchie(Director of King Arthur: Legend of the sword) sat with the editing department while doing these cuts.
There is a dialogue which truly touched my heart.
"Prampancham lo thalli ni minchina yodhulu leru".
This dialogue comes at a situation where it has to be and the background score at that situation is like "Mind Blowing"... Shh, I have no more words with me.
You will get goosebumps throughout the movie.
you might think I'm exaggerating about this movie but, you will feel the same after watching this movie.

Okay, let's start cooking. First things first, ingredients, a lot of them. A main ingredient, (say chicken) and others with varying degrees of importance. Now, take a heating pan, put all things in haphazardly in a random order. Don't worry about how many ingredients you have or how you put them together. What's important is that chicken triumphs all. For the most important part, we should have lot of water sprinkling on hot pan moments: oooh, what a satisfying sound it makes! Let the ingredients drizzle and sizzle over the magnificent chicken, let this go for a while, everything striving for that final catharsis and voila: K.G.F.

reviews.review_title: Its not a Movie, Its An Experience!!
reviews.content:
Firstly... Its a south Indian movie.. So obviously expect some masala and mass. Now people are complimenting the cinemato.. But cinemato tis a bit confusing.. Many a times, there are so many elements on the screen, so attention is diverted. one tends to keep on trying to focus. Specifically during initial fight scenes. If someone wants to watch pirated version of the movie, They are definitely going to miss out on a lot of details, This is a Movie Which Must be Watched in a Theatre.But ,direction lifts the movie.
Direction, screenplay, editing and narration is amazing.
BG music is mind-blowing The trailer was very smartly used. Even the slightest hint of the Main Story is not revealed.
The movie actually grips u throughout.
The narration is amazing.
The last 50 minutes of the movie is a full on guessing game. Where the entire plot gets revealed step by step. It is as if u are giving an exam. The movie takes your complete attention with no other thoughts clouding your mind.Rest Assured The movie is amazing. It is very rare, such quality is offered. This is not a movie, Its An Experience!!
Hats off to KGF crew especially Prashanth Neel, Bhuvan Gowda, Shrikanth, Ravi Basrur, Yash. Climax scene is Mind Blowing. Please don't miss...

KGF released on 21-12-18 with a hope to fulfil the expectations of millions and millions of movie buffs who were enthralled by the trailer and its epic nature. And KGF did not disapppoint. A jewel in the crown of Kannada film industry and by far the best Kannada movie over last many decades. (Dr. Rajkumar/Dr Vishnuvardhan movies are not being used as a benchmark here). I hope this gives a shot in the arm to the Kannada film industry which it so desperately requires in catching up to its more far more successful, established and high grossing industry I.e Tamil & Telugu Film industries. I hope that Kannada film makers become bolder in their story script and screenplay choices and get the necessary funding / support from the industry. And for starting this evolution of cinema in the Kannada fraternity, I give this movie a 10/10.Simple Storyuncomplicated scriptsuper screenplay (some might say shabby - to them I say keep up shabby work)awesome fight sequences and ooh /aah momentsYash has done super but can take it up a notch more I feel. #onemanarmycinematography brilliantOverall a well rounded cinema experienceThings can be better
remove unnecessary fight scenesromance is not necessary in this moviefor god sake - get a shave everyone (just kidding)I am sure the Production team will learn a lot from the critics and responses post the KGF movie release and will bring to us a meaningful end to this two part movie series. Here is wishing all the very best to KGF team.Looking forward to a jaw dropping Chapter 2

KGF Chapter 1! One of the best entertainers ever. Very stylishly made movie. Yash is a treat to watch as the hero. His Screen presence is one of the best for an action movie of this sort. He plays a kind of Spartacus in Karnataka during the 70/80s. The Screenplay is very fast and furious. The story revolves around Yash who is born in the low lands, looses his mother at a very young age and moves on to Mumbai. In Mumbai he becomes a Dons' henchman in style. Later on he is tricked by his rivals into visiting KGF to finish off a formidable villain.The downside of the movie is the many sentiment scenes that are scattered around the movie. Especially there is a lengthy sequence of a story teller narrating a story which tests our patience, because he is telling the story of this movie!. The heroine does not have anything much to do in this film, just like Tamannah Bhatia, who spends a few minutes to dance and entertain us. But she is wasted in such a role.The movie's strength lies in the overall treatment and making of the Visuals. Though a lot of violence is involved, it is the visuals that make this movie a treat to watch. The magnificent presence of Yash is the pinnacle in this kind of story telling. Background score sounds international and adds to the visual treat. The dialogues will be remembered for a long time to come.Yash has scaled new heights with this movie and he may find it difficult to surpass this kind of a powerful role in the near future.Overall this is a movie that is going to be remembered for a long time in Karnataka for all the good reasons.

It's a story of boy's journey to fullfill his mother's last wish. Kgf chapter 1 is emotionally touching, visually spectacular movie. Cinematography and background score makes u feel more realistic as if u r part of it. Yash makes rocky character so much real without much dialogs, action sequences are awsome too. Costumes and looks of each n every character is perfect. Screenplay is more of introductory type but does not effect the whole story. Before interval kgf makes us more enthusiastic but after interval for 20 min that enthusiasm gets little down but after that it makes huge jump after a fight sequence which gives goosebumps n we think what will happen next. Overall its a well balanced emotionally visually n very much appealing to audiences movie. 70s n 80s era is perfectly shown

Right from the word go, the movie sets a tone and maintains it throughout till the end.
Yash is absolutely mesmerizing in every frame. He is not the only person who carries the movie forward, the ensemble cast have been a part of the script and none of them seem off the place.
Prashant Neel and his team needs a special mention for putting up such a show on screen.
Dialogues give you goosebumps and so does the action sequence.
There are a lot of people with sinister intention to downgrade the movie to avoid from it being a super hit.
Shouldn't be an issue as the negative publicity is also making people turn towards the theaters.
A must watch
